channel.title: Homework poem
channel.description:
hi i am in 8th grade AP ELA and i just want to get feedback on this poem i have to do for this clas... its about clams :D
Clams, kind of like families, they sink down in their beds made of sand, with each other, People searching frantically, their feet just almost tipping the head of a clam, almost exposed, the clams try to hide themselves, down, deeper, bubbles start floating to the surface, one clam has been caught, soon to be more.
that was the poem, please give feedback on it and tell me any lines or take away lines.

item.title: Homework poem
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Please do not make it rhyme. Please do not make it be about clams. A good poem may include the word ‘clam’ in it, but at least include a deeper meaning…

Read full topic

item.title: Homework poem
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Roses are red,
Violets are blue,
In Soviet Russia,
Poem writes you. /cool

Lol but on topic, its a nice poem i guess, but i wouldnt know, because i get Fs every time in english when i hear the word “poem”

Read full topic

item.title: Homework poem
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

Thanks. When your current english course is called "the foundations of western literature" you don't get to write fun or creative stuff like this. I wrote a great poem about zombies in 8th grade... I doubt I still have it, but it was fun, and I wrote it in 30 minutes. It all just came to my head so fast, and could pound on the paper. If I find it, I'll post it. It might be on mopar or mitb.

lol np, but that course sounds like its for reaaaaaaaaaaly smart people lol.

i ahve taken that rhyming poem into consideration and i just thought in this situation, it wouldnt seem right, but thanks for that. and yes sorry i did put AP, i meant honors. prolly soon to be AP becuase im in all honor classes.

Read full topic

item.title: Homework poem
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“jaruanna, post:7, topic:384419”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=480184.msg3515191#msg3515191 date=1298925794]

Don’t wanna sound rude, but it does sound like middle school work. Your flow is weak, it’s not needed but a rhyme scheme could’ve easily been implimented.

“one clam has been caught,
soon to be more”

Jesus change that. Ugh…

well my teacher wants us to put it in a contest for whalt witman, and whalt witman doesnt really use rhyme schemes. and yes, it sounds like middle school work, but i am in middle school. and by flow you mean…?

I didn’t know AP was available or else you’d be getting college credits. Your probably just in, what my school calls “GT”, which is above standard and honors.

By flow, I mean stuff like this

“People searching frantically,
their feet just almost tipping the head of a clam,
almost exposed,”

the line “almost exposed” should be elongated, removed, or working into the previous line.

Here is my attempt at the poem:

Clams are like family or friends
digging into the sand before the end
people searching wild and furious
to find the animal that makes them curious

That took like five minutes.

Even if you don’t want it, make rhymes here: http://www.rhymezone.com/
And this is useful, here is for synonyms: http://thesaurus.com/
[/quote]

the almost exposed part i want in there because it makes the reader feel the danger it is in. but thank you again! i might use those sites in the future, and you are a good poem maker. :)[/quote]

Thanks. When your current english course is called “the foundations of western literature” you don’t get to write fun or creative stuff like this. I wrote a great poem about zombies in 8th grade… I doubt I still have it, but it was fun, and I wrote it in 30 minutes. It all just came to my head so fast, and could pound on the paper. If I find it, I’ll post it. It might be on mopar or mitb.

Read full topic

well my teacher wants us to put it in a contest for whalt witman, and whalt witman doesnt really use rhyme schemes. and yes, it sounds like middle school work, but i am in middle school. and by flow you mean…?[/quote]

I didn’t know AP was available or else you’d be getting college credits. Your probably just in, what my school calls “GT”, which is above standard and honors.

By flow, I mean stuff like this

item.title: Homework poem
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

rip4d:

Meaning it doesn’t flow correctly, like its choppy. You wouldn’t write a sentence saying “That man over there. He has 2 dollars in his pocket. Is he poor?”, you’d make it flow properly. The main thing I think he’s getting at is the few lines that are kind of just there, with only 2 or 3 words.

with those 2-3 word lines, i want the reader to kinda “feel” what is happening. but thanks.

kind of like families,

down, deeper,
bubbles start floating to the surface,
one clam has been caught,
soon to be more.

that was the poem, please give feedback on it and tell me any lines or take away lines.
